Nelayan Bandar Lampung Dapat Bantuan Program Konversi BBM Ke BBG DarI Pemerintah
07 Nov 2019, 20:56 by fery nuryadi


Nelayan Bandar Lampung Dapat Bantuan Program Konversi BBM Ke BBG DarI Pemerintah

KBRN, Bandar Lampung  Kementrian ESDM berikan bantuan 345 Mesin kapal berikut 2 tabung gas elpiji 3 kg untuk Sebagai solusi energi alternatif kepada nelayan di Bandar Lampung.   
Dalam kegiatan program konversi sumber energi alternatif dari bahan bakar minyak (BBM) ke Bahan Bakar Gas (BBG) Kementrian Energi dan Sumber Daya Mineral (ESDM) melalui pemerintah kota Bandar Lampung menyerahkan bantuan 345 paket mesin kapal tabung gas elfiji ukuran 3 kg kepada nelayan di Bandar lampung.         
Usai memberikan batuan secara simbolis, Direktur Perencanaan dan Pembangunan Infrastruktur Migas ESDM Alimudin Baso mengatakan, Nelayan Bandar Lampung merupakan yang pertamakali mendapatkan bantuan tersebut.
Menurutnya  bantuan kepada nelayan tersebut di TPI Lempasing tersebut disamping menjalankan program pemerintah pusat untuk solusi penyediaan energi alternatif ramah lingkungan khususnya kepada para nelayan dan petani,  juga untuk mempercepat dan mempermudah aktivitas para nelayan melaut untuk melakukan aktifitasnya mencari tangkapan ikan.
"Bantuan itu untuk mendorong program konversi BBM ke bahan bakar gas BBG untuk solusi penyediaan energi alternatif ramah lingkungan khususnya kepada para nelayan dan petani," ujar Alimudin Baso, di Bandarlampung, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Sehingga, konversi BBM ke BBG tersebut  mampu memberikan kemudahan akses energi dan memberikan pilihan kepada para nelayan serta petani dan juga migrasi ke BBG yang menurutnya  dapat menghemat pengeluaran biaya bahan bakar yang bisa juga meningkatkan kesejahteraan dan ekonomi  masyarakat.
Pihaknya memastikan kepada masyarakat bahwa ketersediaan LPG juga akan tercukupi sebab pihaknya sudah meminta ke Pertamina untuk menambah stok tabung melon di Bandarlampung.
"Saya jamin mereka tidak akan mengalami kekurangan tabung gas karena pertamina siap jaga kesetabilan pasokan itu tapi kami harap juga, para ini nelayan tetap komitmen untuk beli Gas melon ini di SPBU yang  sudah kita siapkan," kata Alimudin.
Ia juga mengatakan dengan adanya program konversi tersebut, subsidi terhadap BBM bisa  dikurangi, dan untuk ke depan pihaknya pun akan membuat jaringan gas di kota Bandar Lampung . namun yang harus mendapatkan dan menggunakan LPG 3 kilo adalah kelompok  masyarakat yang memenuhi kriteria.
Sementara itu Wali Kota Bandarlampung Herman HN mengapresiasi pemerintah pusat yang telah memperhatikan nelayan di kota Bandar lampung  dengan memberikan bantuan mesin kapal beserta BBG.
"Saya ucapkan terimakasih padakementrian  ESDM, karena bantuan tersebut adalah yang kedua kalinya, pertama bantuan gas diberikan di tahun 2017 dan 2019 ini diberikan lagi bantuan melalui program konversi BBM ke BBG," kata Walikota itu.
Menurut Herman, bantuan yang diberikan kementerian ESDM tersebut  akan bermanfaat bagi nelayan dan dapat meningkatkan taraf ekonomi masyarakat sebab dengan menggunakan gas elpiji konsumsi bahan bakar mereka akan lebih efisien.
Pemerintah kota Bandar Lampung juga telah meminta kepada pihak  pertamina agar menjaga ketersediaan LPG di Bandarlampung agar jangan sampai masyarakat sulit untuk mendapatkannya.

Bandar Lampung Fishermen Get Assistance with BBM to BBG Conversion Program from the Government
Nov 07 2019, 20:56 by fery nuryadi


Bandar Lampung Fishermen Get Assistance with BBM to BBG Conversion Program from the Government

KBRN, Bandar Lampung The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources provided assistance of 345 boat engines along with 2 3 kg LPG cylinders for alternative energy solutions to fishermen in Bandar Lampung.
In the program of conversion of alternative energy sources from fuel oil (BBM) to Gas Fuel (BBG) the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) through the Bandar Lampung city government handed over 345 aid packages of 3 kg LPG gas cylinder boat engines to fishermen in Bandar Lampung.
After giving the rock symbolically, the Director of Planning and Development of ESDM Oil and Gas Infrastructure, Alimudin Baso, said that Bandar Lampung fishermen were the first to get the assistance.
According to him, the assistance to the fishermen at TPI Lempasing is in addition to running a central government program to provide environmentally friendly alternative energy solutions, especially to fishermen and farmers, also to accelerate and facilitate the activities of fishermen going to sea to carry out their activities to catch fish.
"The assistance is to encourage the conversion program of BBM to BBG gas fuel for the solution of providing environmentally friendly alternative energy, especially to fishermen and farmers," said Alimudin Baso, in Bandarlampung, Thursday (11/07/2019).
Thus, the conversion of BBM to BBG is able to provide easy access to energy and provide choices for fishermen and farmers as well as migration to BBG which according to him can save on fuel costs that can also improve the welfare and economy of the community.
He said he assured the public that the availability of LPG would also be fulfilled because it had asked Pertamina to increase the stock of melon tubes in Bandarlampung.
"I guarantee that they will not experience a shortage of gas cylinders because Pertamina is ready to maintain the stability of the supply, but we also hope that these fishermen will continue to commit to buy this gas melon at the gas station that we have prepared," said Alimudin.
He also said that with the conversion program, subsidies on fuel could be reduced, and in the future it would build a gas network in the city of Bandar Lampung. however, those who must obtain and use 3-kilogram LPG are community groups that meet the criteria.
Meanwhile, Bandarlampung Mayor Herman HN appreciated the central government for paying attention to fishermen in the city of Bandar Lampung by providing assistance with ship engines and BBG.
"I say thank you to the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, because the assistance is the second time, the first gas assistance was given in 2017 and 2019 was given more assistance through the BBM to BBG conversion program," said the Mayor.
According to Herman, the assistance provided by the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources will benefit fishermen and can improve the economy of the community because by using LPG, their fuel consumption will be more efficient.
The Bandar Lampung city government has also asked Pertamina to maintain the availability of LPG in Bandarlampung so that people do not find it difficult to obtain it.
